programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A slide bed truck carrying a van loses both of its offside wheels and threatens to fall into the inside lane, and a shortcut across a bog causes a dustbin lorry to sink into the mud. Plus, a car has a collision with a petrol tanker, while another has mechanical failure
S05E11

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Lee is confronted by a particularly mouthy motorist who does not know when to call it a day, and Liam arrests a man who denies carrying out a shocking attack, despite the CCTV evidence. Tasers are drawn after a van driver causes carnage and a wanted man holes up in a loft and refuses to come quietly, resulting in a shower of loft insulation, pepper spray and abuse
S14E01

programme.title: Bullet for a Badman (1964)
programme.desc: A disgraced Texas Ranger is charged with murder and sent to prison, but soon manages to escape and sets out to prove his innocence. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Darren McGavin, Ruta Lee and George Tobias

programme.title: Cheyenne Autumn (1964)
programme.desc: Three-hundred members of a Cheyenne tribe that was forcibly resettled on a barren reservation make the dangerous journey to their ancestral homeland. A cavalry officer is assigned the task of bringing them back, but soon begins to sympathise with their plight. John Ford's Western, starring Richard Widmark and James Stewart

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Niaz Waddington is trying to keep a low profile in an unmarked car as he attempts to catch up to a vehicle with cloned plates on the M56. With assistance from PC Mike Clarke, he manages to pull the suspect over for questioning, but they are surprised when they discover the truth behind the cloned plates
S03E05

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Rich Woodward is part of a police operation including two other patrols and a helicopter trying to catch a vehicle being driven with cloned number plates. In Cheshire, Inspector Anton Sullivan is called to a crash between two cars and arrives to find one of the injured drivers has walked away from the scene
S03E06

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Chris Swash and Rowan Burt pursue a vehicle through the streets of Chester and have to continue their chase on foot through muddy fields when the driver runs off after stopping his car. PC Ian Cosgrove attends a serious crash on the M6 involving two cars and an HGV and must carry out breathalyser tests on all drivers to find out exactly how the accident happened
S03E07

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Concerned 999 callers report an HGV swerving all over the M6, so PCs Jamie Barlow and Amy Hollis team up to search for the vehicle in question. When they finally catch up with the driver, they discover the awful truth behind his dangerous driving. On the M56, two trucks have collided near Cheshire Oaks, with reports that one of the drivers may have suffered a heart attack, so Inspector Anton Sullivan races to the scene of the crash to find out exactly what happened
S03E08

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Smurf and Ian travel to the Scottish Highlands to move a 110-ton metal drum used for industrial paper drying, and in Chester a 5-ton freezer unit needs shifting to the racecourse
S02E04

programme.title: Tango & Cash (1989)
programme.desc: Two rival LA detectives are constant thorns in the side of a ruthless drug baron, so he has them framed for murder and sent to prison. Surrounded by vengeful crooks they put behind bars, the combative duo are forced to bury their differences to escape and prove their innocence. Action adventure, with Sylvester Stallone, Kurt Russell, Teri Hatcher and Jack Palance

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A lorry-load of fizzy drinks explodes, going up in smoke and causing traffic chaos on the busy M1. Meanwhile, a 44-tonne artic veers off a country lane and gets stuck in the mud
S05E12

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
South Yorkshire's police interception unit uses 20 cars and two helicopters in its pursuit of a reckless driver across two counties. Officers also discover more than expected when they track down a runaway motorcyclist, and a torrential downpour hampers the work of law enforcers at the scene of a traffic collision on the M1
S04E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Damo is involved in a high-speed pursuit, but the driver manages to give him the slip, while interceptors' helicopter spots five runners from a crashed car. Dog handler Mo is called out to a mansion, Jacko tackles an angry mob after taking down a dodgy scooter driver, and Spike and Pete stop a speeding car driven by a fast talker
S14E04

programme.title: The Rounders (1965)
programme.desc: Two modern-day cowboys are always on the lookout for a way to get rich, but their plans never seem to work out. When they are tricked into taking ownership of a horse that refuses to accept any rider, they see a chance to make a fortune by betting rodeo riders they cannot break in the animal. Comedy Western, starring Henry Fonda, Glenn Ford, Sue Ann Langdon, Hope Holiday and Chill Wills

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
The programme follows officers from Derbyshire's road crime unit as they target dealers bringing drugs into the county, with PC Nick Lovatt giving chase after a sighting of a suspected dealer in Derby. At police HQ, the cops receive intelligence about a van travelling towards Derbyshire suspected of carrying a large amount of cash. The Road Crime Unit heads into position to intercept the van and surround it on the motorway
S09E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A failure to stop in Hartlepool turns into an armed stand-off and a full-blown kidnapping situation, while a 14-year-old boy is found in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, cash and a knife. Lee goes on a high-speed pursuit through Stockton, and Jacko and Simon tackle a drug driver who is wearing a balaclava
S14E06

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran makes his way to the scene of a collision on the A6, where a tired young driver has fallen asleep at the wheel and crashed his car into a lamp post. On the edge of the Peak District, PC Amy Hollis is on the scene of a crash where a car has come off the road and hit a bridge 60ft above a river
S02E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
During a dramatic pursuit, Faulko is rammed off the road at 80mph and has to be rushed to hospital, while the team battles to tackle the aftermath of the crash, and track down the driver responsible. Meanwhile, timing is everything as Liam locks up a rogue biker with the help of patience, pepper spray and the actions of a heroic passer-by
S14E08

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
A police dog unit is called in to try to track down a driver and passenger who have gone missing after a late-night crash on a busy road. The cops think they have their suspects when they stop a couple seen nearby, but when they deny all knowledge of the accident it's down to the officers to link them to the crashed vehicle
S02E07

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught on Camera: A one-off edition of the documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions, focusing on criminals in London involved in robberies, thefts, drug crimes, street brawls and weapons offences. In Soho, police officers monitor the activity of the area's 100,000 nightly visitors from a CCTV control room in an underground bunker, while in Lambeth the air support unit is called in when an armed gang are seen rampaging through the streets

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:

programme.title: King Arthur (2004)
programme.desc: A Roman commander is posted to Britain in the last days of the empire and given a final mission to rescue a high-ranking official and his son stranded in the north. However, the endeavour reveals his true destiny is to lead the Britons against the new Saxon invasion, and marks the start of a legend. Historical adventure, starring Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Ray Winstone, Ioan Gruffudd and Stephen Dillane

programme.desc: A veteran US submarine captain receives an incomplete message after a Russian base falls into rebel hands, and is convinced it is an order to fire his nuclear weapons. However, his first officer refuses to take such potentially devastating action without confirmed orders, leading to a deadly battle of wills. Thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington and Viggo Mortensen

programme.desc: A poker player plans to renounce his gambling ways and become a farmer to support his family. Derbyshire's Road Crime Unit uses intelligence and surveillance tactics to crack down on suspected drug dealers. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a fleeing Vauxhall Astra through the streets of north Hartlepool at more than 100mph, but are forced to call the chase off and the driver later robs a supermarket at knife-point, sparking a huge manhunt. Liam and his sniffer dog Louie take part in the search of a house that uncovers thousands in cash and nearly £500,000 in class A drugs, while firearms officers rush to Guisborough at 11pm on a Friday after a caller claims that a man with a shotgun is walking around the town
S14E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.desc:
The Paine Family: Stacey challenges members of the Paine family to declutter their home in seven days. In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet
S03E07

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

As the hospital is evacuated, Faith takes desperate measures to try to get hold of more pills, and Cam proves he can keep his cool in a crisis as he sets up a temporary treatment unit in the car park

programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.desc: The Repair Shop: A Royal Visit: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc:
Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death

programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc:
Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars

programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Coronation Kitchen Live: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jennie Bond and Gyles Brandreth for a special celebratory edition of the show to mark the Coronation of King Charles III. Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Coronation: the UK Celebrates - Live
programme.desc: Reports from around the nation about how people marked the occasion of the crowning of King Charles and Queen Camilla yesterday

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year
S2023E19

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: To mark to coronation of King Charles, this special edition of the show goes back through the archives to celebrate items with a royal connection. Fiona Bruce is intrigued by a collection of coronation souvenirs from the past that have been preserved in the Museum of Brands, and ceramics expert Serhat Ahmet offers tips on the most collectable coronation keepsakes

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert

Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

Chefs Adam Byatt and Anna Haugh are also in the studio to rustle up royal recipes, and resident expert Helen McGinn has an array of drinks perfect for any celebration

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.desc:

John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.desc:
Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: A Coronation Celebration: Katherine Jenkins celebrates the coronation of King Charles III at Hampton Court Palace, and explores how faith and spirituality will shape his reign. Inside The Great Hall, Katherine talks to royal historian Dr Tracy Borman to discover how the echoes of the past still resonate in our monarchy and nations today, while Pam Rhodes visits broadcaster and friend of the King, Jonathan Dimbleby, to find out more about His Majesty's deep Christian faith and how this will influence his role as monarch

programme.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
programme.desc: The duo open their own bakery, Top Bun, and business is soon booming - not least because a 'cereal killer' is targeting all the rival bakers in town. Even better, Wallace has caught the eye of local beauty Piella Bakewell. But Gromit is more concerned that his master might become the killer's next victim. With the voices of Peter Sallis and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Frozen Planet II
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, in a journey from the Arctic to the Antarctic. Polar bears meet on the frozen Arctic Ocean, while pack ice in Greenland provides a nursery for baby harp seals. A pack of wolves hunts for bison, a pallas cat struggles to hunt in heavy snow, and golden eagles take on prey much larger than themselves. Weddell seals haul themselves onto the Antarctic ice, while a pod of killer whales develops a strategy for hunting them

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
A Rural Welcome Revisit: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor revisit the New Forest, 10 months on from their first visit, to catch up with the community and families who have come together to help Ukrainian refugees. Since Russia invaded Ukraine back in February 2022, nearly 170,000 people have arrived in the UK, with rural communities across the country giving them a warm welcome. Margherita catches up with a mother and daughter who fled the war zone, to find out how life has been since arriving in rural Hampshire over a year ago, while Matt revisits a group of volunteers who were collecting and packing Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine and Poland, to find out how their operation has changed over the last year

programme.title: The Coronation Concert
programme.desc: Coverage of the Coronation Concert from the East Lawn of Windsor Castle, staged in front of 20,000 members of the public and invited guests. Featuring performances from Take That, Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Andrea Bocelli, Bryn Terfel, Freya Ridings and a 70-piece orchestra as well as unique visual moments such as the country joining together as its most iconic landmarks are illuminated by drones and lasers in Lighting Up the Nation and Gareth Malone's 300-voice Coronation Choir singing for the King and Queen. Kirsty Young hears from the performers in a specially built studio within the castle grounds, and backstage, Clara Amfo and Jordan Banjo grab chats with others involved

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world
