programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Inside the Bat Cave
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke presents a documentary taking a journey into the secret world of one of the most endangered and least understood animals on Earth - bats. With cutting-edge night-vision cameras and ultrasonic detectors, this programme follows a greater horseshoe bat roost for four months, capturing the hidden life of the colony as never before, witnessing the birth of a new generation of pups and tracking their progress towards their perilous maiden flights outside the roost

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc:
Barcelona: An Art Lovers' Guide: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miró and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí
S01E02

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. She recalls an opera about fabrics that she wrote and performed at high school for a home economics project, how she staged puppet shows for children's parties, and the huge impact that reading George Orwell had on her

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
A Woman's Place: Documentary examining the impact of novels from three perspectives - the empire, class experience and, in this first film, women's voices. The programme aims to show the plight of women is a theme that reaches right back to the earliest novels, with extracts from Jane Austen, the Brontes, Mary Shelley and Virginia Woolf, through to the post-war publishing boom where a new generation of global writers such as Zadie Smith, Toni Morrison, Arundhati Roy and Margaret Atwood have continued to speak out for women to a new generation of readers
S01E01

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Craftivism: Making a Difference
programme.desc: Writer, comedian and art lover Jenny Eclair meets people doing extraordinary things with knitting, cross-stitch, banners and felt to change hearts and minds across the world

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Michael Palin's Quest for Artemisia
programme.desc: The Monty Python star sets off on a quest to investigate the story of little-known 17th-century Italian artist Artemisia Gentileschi after one of her paintings caught his eye. Michael encounters her work in Florence, Rome and Naples, and finds out about her life as a working mother and her ultimate success against all odds as a great painter of the Baroque age who transformed the way women were depicted in art, and who was sought after in many courts across Europe

programme.title: East of Ipswich
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Richard Burrill is dragged to the seaside by his parents where he meets Edwin, another teenager with strong views on life, and a Dutch girl with an eye for the boys. Nostalgic comedy, starring John Nettleton and written by Michael Palin

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Kangsar to Cameron Highlands: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride
S01E16

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters
S04E04

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Great Railway Journeys of the World: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season
S01E04

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda (1988)
programme.desc: A stuffy English barrister representing a jewel thief is targeted by his client's partners in crime - a seductive American crook and her dim-witted would-be philosopher lover who will go to any lengths to discover where the diamonds from their last heist have been hidden. Crime comedy, starring John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin and Tom Georgeson

programme.title: Blue Murder at St Trinian's (1957)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls travel by coach to Europe, accompanied by a wanted jewel thief dressed as a woman, and an undercover police detective. Comedy, starring Lionel Jeffries, Joyce Grenfell, Terry-Thomas, George Cole and Alistair Sim

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc:
Great British Comedies: Talking Pictures: Interviews with British comedy stars of the silver screen, featuring the likes of George Formby, Peter Sellers and the Monty Python team. Narrated by Sylvia Syms
S02E16

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Kangsar to Cameron Highlands: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride
S01E16

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters
S04E04

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Great Railway Journeys of the World: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season
S01E04

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Bruno Brookes introduces an edition originally broadcast on 18 August 1994, featuring performances by Oasis, Tinman, Eternal, Youssou N'dour Feat. Neneh Cherry, and Boyz Ii Men

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 September 1994 and featuring Blur and Phil Daniels, Sean Maguire, Terrorvision, Youssou N'Dour and Neneh Cherry, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Children for Rwanda, Boyz II Men, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1977: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from May 5, 1977, a week that saw Deniece Williams top the chart for the first time with her single Free. The show also features performances by Joy Sarney, Rod Stewart, Frankie Valli, Bay City Rollers, Mac & Katie Kissoon, Mr Big, Leo Sayer, Delegation and Tavares

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1984: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3, 1984 show, featuring OMD, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran

programme.title: Fanny: The Right to Rock
programme.desc: The story of critically acclaimed 1970s all-woman Filipino rock group Fanny, who despite critical acclaim and regular tours with bands including Chicago, Steely Dan and Slade, faced both sexism and racism. Now as they re-form to record a new album in their seventies, they challenge the stigma of ageism as well. With contributions from Bonnie Raitt, Todd Rundgren, the Runaways' Cherie Currie, Lovin' Spoonful's John Sebastien, Def Leppard's Joe Elliott, David Bowie's guitarist Earl Slick and bassist Gail Ann Dorsey, and Steely Dan's Jeff 'Skunk' Baxter

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat

programme.title: Siouxsie and the Banshees: Rock Goes to College
programme.desc: Pete Drummond introduces a 1981 performance by the gothic new wave band at Warwick University, with songs including Israel, Spellbound, Arabian Knights, Halloween and Christine

programme.title: Radio 2 Live at Home
programme.desc: Chrissie Hynde and the band recorded for Radio 2 in 2020, with favourites including Brass in Pocket, Stop Your Sobbing, Back on the Chain Gang and I'll Stand By You, as well as a few new numbers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Bruno Brookes introduces an edition originally broadcast on 18 August 1994, featuring performances by Oasis, Tinman, Eternal, Youssou N'dour Feat. Neneh Cherry, and Boyz Ii Men

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 September 1994 and featuring Blur and Phil Daniels, Sean Maguire, Terrorvision, Youssou N'Dour and Neneh Cherry, Luther Vandross and Mariah Carey, Children for Rwanda, Boyz II Men, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1977: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from May 5, 1977, a week that saw Deniece Williams top the chart for the first time with her single Free. The show also features performances by Joy Sarney, Rod Stewart, Frankie Valli, Bay City Rollers, Mac & Katie Kissoon, Mr Big, Leo Sayer, Delegation and Tavares

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1984: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3, 1984 show, featuring OMD, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran

programme.title: For Folk's Sake: Morris Dancing and Me
programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Absolute Desert: Michael reaches the city of Timbuktu, along with a camel train carrying the giant salt blocks that made the city one of the greatest centres of Islamic learning. Later, Michael finally gets to grips with the heart and soul of the desert
S01E03

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: Homeward (2019)
programme.desc: Mustafa, a Crimean Tatar, and his son Alim transport the body of Mustafa's other son, a soldier killed in combat, from Kyiv to Crimea to give him a proper burial. Drama, starring Akhtem Seitablaev and Remzi Bilyalov. In Crimean Tatar, Ukrainian and Russian

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Golden Gordon: Michael Palin and Terry Jones wrote this classic comedy, in which Palin stars as a soccer fan whose obsession with the world's worst team causes misery for both him and his long-suffering family. With Gwen Taylor and Bill Fraser. First shown in 1979
S02E02

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Roger of the Raj: Youngster Roger Bartlesham experiences a sexual awakening in colonial India, but the emotional turmoil leads him to commit a deplorable act. Final episode of the comedy series, starring Michael Palin, Richard Vernon, John Le Mesurier and Joan Sanderson. First shown in 1979
S02E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Dire Straits: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Passage to India: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama
S01E02

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Spring Soul and Jazz from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Guy Barker's Big Band and the BBC Concert Orchestra join forces at the Cheltenham Jazz Festival, with guest performers including Kurt Elling, Mica Paris, Madeline Bell, Mica Millar, Ashton Jones, Vanessa Haynes, Tommy Blaize and Ian Shaw. They play music celebrating the jazz and soul explosion of the late 1950s, and with over 80 musicians on stage and a great line-up of guests, it promises to be an extraordinary night of music. Presented by Marcus Brigstocke

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Resident choreographer at the Royal Ballet and director of his own dance company, Wayne McGregor's dance achievements know no bounds both at home and internationally. Alan Yentob joins Wayne over a busy few months, from his role as director at the Venice Dance Biennale, creating a new production with his own company of dancers, to the rehearsals and opening of The Dante Project, a new ballet at the Royal Opera House in London

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. At the beginning of 1945, Berlin remains under the spell of the Nazi promise of salvation, an illusion at odds with the city's daily reality of bombing raids, fires to be extinguished and corpses to be buried. Life goes on as the front lines of the war close in each day
S01E01

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: The last of three programmes originally shown in 1977 to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee, and celebrating the landscape of England, Scotland and Wales from a unique perspective. Here, Iain Cuthbertson narrates this documentary taking a helicopter's-eye view of Scotland, taking viewers north to Shetland, south to the Tweed and everywhere in between

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Lumpur to Melaka: Michael Portillo explores the growth of Kuala Lumpur, from a swampland tin mine to a major British colony, before becoming a major economic powerhouse in its own right. He makers jewellery at the Royal Selangor pewter factory, samples Malaysia's national dish, and investigates the scandalous behaviour of an infamous British resident general at the turn of the 20th century
S01E17

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
The Early Pioneers: The development of steam power, from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to modern-day nuclear power stations. Fred travels to Cornwall to investigate the use of early engines to pump water out of the tin mines
S01E01

programme.title: Cornwall's Red River
programme.desc: Poet John Wedgwood Clarke explores the Red River in Cornwall. Despite being heavily polluted by centuries of tin mining, it is also home to some rare and resilient wildlife

programme.title: David Attenborough's Zoo Quest in Colour
programme.desc: A one-off special showcasing colour footage from the 1950s wildlife series that launched the career of a young David Attenborough as a nature presenter. Using new-found film and behind-the-scenes stories from Attenborough and cameraman Charles Lague, this programme features clips of the best of Zoo Quest to West Africa, Zoo Quest to Guiana and Zoo Quest for a Dragon

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alice Neel: Imagine: Born in 1900, American artist Alice Neel portrayed the 20th century until her death in 1984, painting the people around her - those on the margins of society as well as the ones involved in her own hard and complicated life. This profile of Neel was made by her grandson Andrew, who combines home-movie footage and candid interviews with family and friends

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Pulse: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Llanelli 1/5: Council manager Charlotte hosts the first dinner party in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, where she hopes to impress electrician Steve, occupational nurse Christine, retired French teacher Meic, and teaching assistant Ainsley with an evening that features a former rugby choir as entertainment

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In the West Country, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party. On the first night, handyman Sam and his wife Kate attempt a restaurant quality meal. On night two, proud Somerset pair Colin and Kate host at their family farm and serve pork sourced from Colin's brother's pig farm. On the final night, festival lovers Aron and Kath put on a beach-themed dinner party, and although they are confident about their culinary prowess, disaster strikes on not one, but two courses. The rest of their meal comes together well, but is it enough to bag the cash prize of £1,000?
S2020E30

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Central Algarve: Semi-retired travel rep Nicola Harrison from Dorset has spent a season 22 years ago looking after holiday-makers in the Algarve, and now fancies moving there herself. She enlists the help of Jasmine Harman who looks for properties that will aid Nicola in the next chapter of her life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Estepona, Costa del Sol: Renuka Joseph is looking for a holiday home where she can entertain family and friends and relax with her husband Clarence. She's originally from Sri Lanka and has chosen the Costa del Sol as her perfect spot because the beaches remind her of home. She's brought her best friend Shanez along to help, so Jasmine Harman shows them five apartments in and around Estepona for her £80,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: St Lucia: Newly engaged couple Natasha and Extus from London have £300,000 to spend on their first home together, on St Lucia. Extus grew up there, and Natasha has been in love with the island ever since holidaying there for the first time 15 years ago. They're looking for a home that can also double up as a luxury B&B. Danni Menzies shows them five properties to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
As the end of the summer approaches, two gite owners in France prepare for their first guests, a business trio embark on a new venture in Spain, and a family-of-five seeks to find its dream home and business in Italy
S07E35

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Cockermouth, Cumbria, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet blacksmith Jon, who spent many years working on fairgrounds. At the valuation, independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan reckons there's rich pickings to be made from railway memorabilia
S05E05

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 1/5: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 2/5: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 3/5: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 4/5: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 5/5: Fiery Brazilian Rosie is confident that her night will be the best of the week in Peterborough. After Gregory used packet mixes, Rosie is determined to show him how to throw a dinner party by making everything from scratch. She's ruffled a few feathers throughout the week with her brutally honest critiques, and her guests, roused for retribution, scour every element of her Brazilian night for any faults, from her samba dancers to her authentic pig-ear stew

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman heads to the inland towns and villages of Almería province in southern Spain to help Candy and Mark find the perfect holiday home before their wedding in six months

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Curious four-month-old terrier puppies Bobo and Lenny start scouting out their new surroundings at the centre. The brother and sister are completely different in looks and personality, but both need a forever home. Meanwhile, the staff bring together 82-year-old Alan and lhasa apso Ruby, both of whom are looking for comfort after losing a loved one
S01E05

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A delivery driver is the victim of a carjacking and ends up being dragged along the road. On the M40, 13 stowaway migrants are found in a lorry full of tyres and in need of urgent medical care. A man collapses while having a fit in the middle of a busy road, and a woman experiences uncontrollable spasms in her legs at the stress of losing a child
S06E01

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: Le Mans '66 (2019)
programme.desc: Racing car driver and engineer Carroll Shelby is lured out of retirement during the 1960s, in a period where the sport is dominated by Italian companies. Ford Motors are hoping to revive their flagging fortunes by launching a racing division and securing a high-profile win at the prestigious Le Mans 24-hour race. Shelby takes up the challenge of headlining the plan to build a revolutionary new race car, but courts conflict within the company by recruiting unpredictable, short-tempered British driver Ken Miles to take the wheel. Fact-based drama, starring Matt Damon, Christian Bale, Jon Bernthal and Caitriona Balfe

programme.title: Andrew: The Problem Prince
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes telling the inside story of Prince Andrew's 2019 Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis and the subsequent chain of events that led to a royal disaster. In the 1980s, Andrew was a Falklands war hero and a national heart-throb, glory years that culminated in his marriage to Sarah Ferguson. But following his departure from the Navy, his image took a turn as his new role as trade envoy proved unsuccessful - and his need to fund a lavish lifestyle and friendship with Jeffrey Epstein eventually prompted the interview that cemented his downfall
S01E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E10

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. Elsewhere, two diners bond over their shared love of dogs, a farmer presents his date with a gift of beetroot, and a woman discovers she has met her supposedly blind date before
S20E03

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc:
The Rothschild's giraffes are expecting a new addition as 12-year-old matriarch Dagmar, whose last calf died after a few days, goes into labour after a 15-month pregnancy. Orang-utan sisters Tuti and Siska, and their baby cousin Kesuma, rebuild their relationship after the trauma of the fire that engulfed their habitat in December 2018, while the keepers set off in pursuit when a blue-throated macaw goes on the run
S08E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Llanelli 2/5: Electrician Steve hosts the second night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and hopes that his menu of lasagne, vegetable soup and homemade wine will impress his guests and win him the £1,000 prize. As the evening goes on, Meic decides to bare all with a revelation that shocks Christine

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In Somerset, three rival duos compete to host the best dinner party. Married couple Jacqueline and Stephen host first with their Mediterranean menu. On day two, social media enthusiast Jess and her boyfriend Fred show off their Portuguese cooking. On the last night, Jacqueline, Stephen, Jess and Fred have high expectations for Rob and Simon's culinary skills
S2020E15

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Altea, Costa Blanca: Laura Hamilton helps former firefighter Gary Sheen and his partner Kevin Lambert from Essex find a new home in the Altea region of Spain's Costa Blanca. With a budget of £175,000, the couple are torn between a two-bedroom apartment with jaw-dropping views, or a town house opposite one of their favourite restaurants

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Torrevieja: Dave and Debbie Chambers from Redditch, Worcestershire, started their family young, but now their four children have grown up, they've decided to recapture their youth and buy a place in Spain where they can enjoy time in the sun - just the two of them. For their budget of £45,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments in and around the town of Torrevieja, but will any of them be their perfect place?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Motorbike fan David is keen to move to Almería, but wife Fiona will take some convincing before she leaves Yorkshire. Pilates fan Esther searches for a holiday home in Alicante
S05E08

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A derelict building in a French village gets a new lease of life. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple dip their toes into their first season as holiday hosts, and in southern France, a very special event takes place in a refurbished chapel
S01E20

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to
S05E06

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 1/5: Sports fanatic James Cox hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Northampton, and he is confident that his French-Italian menu will bag him the £1,000 prize. However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 2/5: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 3/5: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. However, the night gets off to a shaky start as Donna Harris finds a hair on the side of her goat's cheese salad, while businessman Duncan Fielding seems more interested in goats themselves than the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 4/5: Party-loving Barb Wiles hosts the fourth dinner party in the Northampton area, and hopes her Australian-themed menu will wow her guests and win her the £1,000 prize. However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 5/5: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Peyia, Cyprus: Jasmine Harman travels to Peyia in western Cyprus to help Pauline and Chris find their perfect holiday home on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
The charity version of the popular baking show returns, and with Noel Fielding on paternity leave, Matt Lucas is presenting on his own. In previous editions, comedian Tom Allen has stepped in to co-present - but today he is showing off his baking skills as one of the contestants, alongside Star Wars actress Daisy Ridley, comedian Rob Beckett and singer Alexandra Burke. To impress Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith, the celebrities serve up millionaire shortbread, a fruity tart and their pet hates in cake form in the showstopper
S04E01

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the family room and how best to use the empty space downstairs. They draw inspiration from the Chinese bedroom at Longleat House and the plant-based textiles and natural dyes on display at London Fashion Week. Sarah realises that she can't carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area.
S03E03

programme.title: Andrew: The Problem Prince
programme.desc:
News/Current Affairs
S01E01

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. Elsewhere, two diners bond over their shared love of dogs, a farmer presents his date with a gift of beetroot, and a woman discovers she has met her supposedly blind date before
S20E03

programme.title: Mr & Mrs Smith (2005)
programme.desc: An outwardly bored suburban couple lead double lives as professional assassins, both unaware of their partner's secret. When they are hired to kill each other, the deadly situation puts some much-needed excitement back into their stale relationship. Comedy adventure, starring Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn and Adam Brody

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
With just 48 hours till extraction, Saffron and Bobby take a risk and go solo. Nik and Eva continue to taunt the hunters with a postcard from the Welsh coast but their route to the extraction point is nerve-wracking. Hunter HQ use every trick they have in the final push to catch the celebrities before they are extracted and tensions rise with close calls, a motorway pursuit and a desperate foot race as the competition comes to an adrenaline-fuelled end
S05E06

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Working from Home: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows highlighting the way working from home is changing the way many people live. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?
S01E05

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc:
Hairdresser Alex wants more muscle and young mum Elle wants to be rid of her stretch marks. Will their life-size post-surgery avatars help make up their minds?
S01E10

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Llanelli 3/5: Occupational nurse Christine hosts the third dinner party in Llanelli, where she tries to impress her guests with a menu of family favourites and a performance by her number one rock band. Charlotte and Meic stumble across the host's messy office, and trouble brews when Ainsley tells Christine that she looks like one of her exes

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Three couples compete in Glasgow for the cash prize of £1,000. First to host are tearoom owner Melanie and her Irish husband David, who have blended together their heritages with a Celtic-fusion menu. Night two sees Kenny and Kenny, a married couple whose love of Mexico sees them trying to replicate authentic local food from their beloved country. Last to host are motormouth Ami and husband Stuart, who aim to impress with their well-presented Scottish food

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Jasmine finds them five homes suited to their £150,000 budget, including a property reduced by £50,000, and a house that feels just like their place back in the UK

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Southern Spain: Keen walkers Rosie and Michael Mulroy from Durham are looking for a holiday home from which they can explore the stunning Andalusian hills and countryside around Frigiliana in southern Spain. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their £120,000 budget, from town centre apartments to quaint village townhouses, but will any of them appeal to both heart and head?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
On the Costa Blanca, Manuel Rodriguez and daughter Sophie are hoping to make a transatlantic dream a reality. Clients Vinny and Julie met a decade ago online, and now American-born Julie and Briton Vinny are hungry for a third location where they can enjoy more romantic rendezvous time together. With 100,000 euros to spend, Vinny's determined to bag them a bargain, but the property must come with one thing - a barbecue

programme.desc: Guildford 1/5: In Guildford, Surrey, the first host is glamorous 22-year-old cosmetic-surgery-fan Shanice, who hopes to show she is more than just a pretty face by serving up sumptuous food and dazzling conversation. The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 2/5: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 3/5: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 4/5: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 5/5: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. However, his unusual fayre is tempered by his choice of yodelling entertainment, which threatens to hinder his chance of scooping the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Billionaire Blooms
programme.desc:
Cameras delve behind the scenes to observe the work of some of the UK's top florists as they create floral wonderlands for their super-wealthy clients. In this first episode, Jamie is in Italy for his toughest gig yet, the wedding of one of his most treasured clients. A multi-venue event spans four days and the length and breadth of Venice. Jamie needs to transport himself, his team of almost 40 and over 100,000 stems of the best flowers available everywhere by boat, in baking heat. Back in London, Afia tackles an outdoor wedding and has to think on her feet when construction issues threaten her design

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 1/5: Nursing manager Sarah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, taking inspiration from her husband's Middle Eastern heritage to offer her guests a Turkish fusion menu. Joining her is 28-year-old painter decorator Alex, 45-year-old bridal shop owner Abbi, 60-year-old community centre manager Janet and 56-year-old record label boss Phil. A hilarious evening lies in store, with unexpected tattoos, beauty tips and twerking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 2/5: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. Part of Janet's plan is to pretend her house is haunted and she has a practical joke lined up for nursing manager Sarah and bridal shop owner Abbi to find. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 3/5: Record label owner Phil hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, hoping to win the £1,000 prize money by serving up a 1970s rock-themed menu. His guests are astounded by his mystery past, and painter and decorator Alex is unimpressed when wedding shop owner Abbi continues to wind him up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 4/5: Painter and decorator Alex hosts the fourth night in Leeds, hoping to win the prize money by serving up a cruise-themed menu from around the world - which impresses jealous rival Janet so much, she almost turns violent. Abbi continues to belittle the host - until he reveals he spends his evenings on stage impersonating a famous heart-throb singer. Will his performance bag him the top prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Leeds 5/5: Bridal shop owner Abbi hopes to woo her guests with a wedding-themed party on the final day of the competition in Leeds. All week Abbi and Michael Buble impersonator Alex have had a bit of a banter that has sailed close to the wind. Will the tension take over, or can the wedding theme create an amorous atmosphere that will help Abbi win the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:

Clients Vinny and Julie met a decade ago online, and now American-born Julie and Briton Vinny are hungry for a third location where they can enjoy more romantic rendezvous time together. With 100,000 euros to spend, Vinny's determined to bag them a bargain, but the property must come with one thing - a barbecue

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses

The couple have their hearts set on a new build property and have asked Laura Hamilton to help find them the perfect one. Laura lines up various options for their maximum budget of £260,000, but will any impress them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: A teacher is reunited with her ex-boyfriend while staying in an Italian village. The former lovers are forced to work together when her teenage daughter and his 80-year-old mother steal a car and run away to Rome together, the former hoping to return home to her boyfriend and the latter planning to remarry against her son's wishes. Romantic comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Raoul Bova and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: The Others (2001)
programme.desc: A woman awaits the return of her husband from the Second World War while struggling to care for her son and daughter. Both children suffer a violent reaction when exposed to daylight, forcing her to keep much of their isolated home on the island of Jersey shrouded in gloom. When the pair claim to see strangers in the house, their terrified mother begins to suspect that the souls of the dead are stalking the halls. Period supernatural thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Fionnula Flanagan, Alakina Mann, James Bentley and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Walking Out (2017)
programme.desc: An urban teenager journeys to Montana to hunt big game with his estranged father. The duo struggle to connect, until a brutal encounter in the wilderness changes everything. Adventure, starring Matt Bomer, Josh Wiggins and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Robert the Bruce (2019)
programme.desc: Following the execution of William Wallace, Robert the Bruce has suffered a number of losses. Ex-communicated and with a large bounty on his head, the wounded, hunted warrior seeks refuge with a single mother and her family, and reflects on the choices he must make if he wishes to lead Scotland to victory. Drama, starring Angus Macfadyen, Jared Harris, Anna Hutchison and Patrick Fugit

programme.title: The Congress (2013)
programme.desc: An ageing out-of-work actress receives an offer from a major studio to sell her cinematic identity to them to use in future productions. Sci-fi drama, starring Robin Wright and Harvey Keitel
